{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.06938v1", "title": "On the Compressibility of Integral Operators in Anisotropic Wavelet
  Coordinates", "summary": "The present article is concerned with the s*-compressibility of classical
boundary integral operators in anisotropic wavelet coordinates. Having the
s*-compressibility at hand, one can design adaptive wavelet algorithms which
are asymptotically optimal, meaning that any target accuracy can be achieved at
a computational expense that stays proportional to the number of degrees of
freedom (within the setting determined by an underlying wavelet basis) that
would ideally be necessary for realising that target accuracy if full knowledge
about the unknown solution were given. As we consider here anisotropic wavelet
coordinates, we can achieve higher convergence rates compared to the standard,
isotropic setting. Especially, edge singularities of anisotropic nature can be
resolved.", "main_category": "math.NA", "categories": "math.NA,cs.NA", "published": "2025-04-09T14:42:01Z"}
